summary:
Healthcare, health protection and health promotion has been the common theme of my professional life. As a nurse, public health professional, field epidemiologist and project manager clinical trials, I have worked with all kinds of parties, which has greatly increased my understanding of different points of view and interests. I have lots of experience working outside of the Netherlands in developing and developed countries.
My qualities are my ability to gather information, to work together with subject matter experts, to quickly analyze, process and incorporate new information, and to create tools to help professionals to work more efficiently. I enjoy working with a team in a dynamic environment where challenges are complex, and where solutions contribute to people's health: especially those most in need of health improvement.

profile_positions.description:
•	Supporting and monitoring of surveillance activities (active case finding, case investigation, assessing transmission chains, contact tracing and monitoring, social mobilization of the local population)
 •	Coordination with staff from the local Ministry of Health and Sanitation and other non-governmental and governmental agencies
•	Responsible for the patient database of the Ebola Management Centre (data entry, data reporting, data cleaning and validation)
 •	Investigating underreporting of deaths, and the public's awareness with regards to death reporting
 •	Conducting a retrospective mortality survey
profile_positions.title: Field epidemiologist Ebola outbreak management

profile_positions.company: RIVM National Institute for Public Health and the Environment
profile_positions.description:
•	Member of the Early Warning Unit (‘Signaleringsoverleg’) identifying events of infectious diseases posing a threat to the Dutch public health, and secretariat for the Early Warning Unit for outbreaks of health care acquired infections and antimicrobial resistant pathogens in health care facilities
•	Facilitating the efficient use of the national notifiable infectious diseases surveillance database (OSIRIS), liaison person between the RIVM and the Public Health Units (GGD’en) 
•	(Alternate) national surveillance focal point for the European Centre for Disease prevention and Control (ECDC ) regarding surveillance of infectious diseases at the European level 
•	Coordinating and writing advice to the Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sport with regards to the mandatory notification of cases of dengue, chikungunya and tularaemia.
profile_positions.title: Epidemiologist early warning and surveillance of infectious diseases

profile_positions.description:
OzFoodNet is an Australian Government Department of Health and Ageing initiative. It funds the Department of Health in Australia's States and Territories to employ one or two epidemiologists to investigate and understand foodborne disease, to describe more effectively its epidemiology and to identify ways to minimize foodborne illness in Australia.

Main responsibilities:

•	Surveillance of notifiable foodborne and zoonotic infectious diseases
•	Detection and epidemiological investigations of outbreaks of these diseases
•	Analyzing and reporting of national surveillance data to the general public, the scientific community and the government
•	Providing ‘on call’ duty: advise professionals of Public Health Units ('GGD'en') with regards to the implementation of guidelines to manage individual cases or outbreaks of infectious diseases.  
•	Writing foodborne and zoonotic infectious diseases control guidelines for public health units (GGD’en)
•	Providing surge capacity ('opschaling') in response to large scale outbreaks such as the influenza A H1N1 pandemic in 2009.
profile_positions.title: Epidemiologist gastro-intestinal and zoonotic infectious diseases

profile_positions.description:
Managed projects in areas such as policy, research, health promotion, surveillance and epidemiology, e.g. a project to propose strategies to increase blood lead screening rates in young children in a remote mining town.

Surge capacity response to the mass gathering of peope during World Youth Day 2008, and epidemiological support to the NSW Department of Primary Industry during the equine influenza outbreak in 2007.
profile_positions.title: Trainee Public Health Officer
